entry.title: Pomponio State Beach
entry.summary: It's been far too long since I took my camera out. Since our original morning plans got rained out, we decided to go to the beach instead. It's lovely being able to just drive to the ocean on a whim.
entry.content: It's been far too long since I took my camera out. Since our original morning plans got rained out, we decided to go to the beach instead. It's lovely being able to just drive to the ocean on a whim.

entry.title: Yosemite
entry.summary: We figured that since we live so close to Yosemite now (less than four hours) it would be a shame not to spend some time there. It's certainly different--no cell service unless you're in the heart of the park itself--but well worth it. So beautiful.
entry.content: We figured that since we live so close to Yosemite now (less than four hours) it would be a shame not to spend some time there. It's certainly different--no cell service unless you're in the heart of the park itself--but well worth it. So beautiful.

entry.title: Santa Cruz
entry.summary: My parents are visiting for the week, so we took a trip down to the Santa Cruz Boardwalk and neighboring Seabright State Beach. This time though, I took some pictures!
entry.content: My parents are visiting for the week, so we took a trip down to the Santa Cruz Boardwalk and neighboring Seabright State Beach. This time though, I took some pictures!

entry.title: Pacifica
entry.summary: It feels good to be out and about taking pictures again. Aurora and I went down to the beach at Pacifica. We had once before, but this time we walked up the big hill / small mountain at the north end of the beach. Such a view!
entry.content: It feels good to be out and about taking pictures again. Aurora and I went down to the beach at Pacifica. We had once before, but this time we walked up the big hill / small mountain at the north end of the beach. Such a view!

entry.title: Historical Photosets: 2005
entry.summary:
And here is the second half of my old photots, from 2005. I know that there should be more after these--I didn't just stop taking pictures for years. Yet so far I haven't found them. So it goes.

East Coast Exploration

From a family vacation to the East Cost: Baltimore, New York City, and Washington DC.
entry.content:
And here is the second half of my old photots, from 2005. I know that there should be more after these--I didn't just stop taking pictures for years. Yet so far I haven't found them. So it goes.

East Coast Exploration

From a family vacation to the East Cost: Baltimore, New York City, and Washington DC.

Hiking at Hemlock

We took a field trip to Hemlock Cliffs. It was a lot of fun, the area is really good for pictures.

Cabin and Louie's

A combination of shots from the cabin that dad used to hang out at and Uncle Louie's house.

Walking Maggie II

Walking Maggie again. Butt Hill is so named for the part of your body that gets a particular workout when you climb it.

Stinklets ... And then Some

Young skunks are amazingly cute.

entry.title: Historical Photosets: 2004
entry.summary:
For rather too long I've been sitting on several years of old pictures I took, back before I first got my DSLR. Well, there's no time like the present!

Here is the first set, from 2004.

Firetower

One of the oldest sets I have--Hannah and I visited the fire tower at the Hoosier National Forest.
entry.content:
For rather too long I've been sitting on several years of old pictures I took, back before I first got my DSLR. Well, there's no time like the present!

Here is the first set, from 2004.

Firetower

One of the oldest sets I have--Hannah and I visited the fire tower at the Hoosier National Forest.

At Home

A series of pictures at and around home. So green!

A Random Field

Just behind home... So perhaps not so random after all?

Beta Convention

This year's National Beta Convention. IU really is a beautiful campus. I'm sure my parents would be thrilled if I ended up there in a few years.

(It's interesting how things turn out.)

Sunday

A lazy Sunday afternoon spent at my aunt's and uncle's house.

Halloween

All Hallows' Eve spent at Patoka Lake.

At Home II 2004-11-09

Another photoset at home. Nothing much more to say about it.

Riding at Hannah's

Hannah and I went riding across the highway from her house. It's interesting--such a feeling of freedom.

Olinger Thanksgiving 2004

Family Thanksgiving. My how the family is growing...

entry.title: Adventures in Florida
entry.summary:
Our first big trip and everything went just about as well as could be expected. We (almost) had a tropical storm (awesome), were lazy, and found a fair few neat things to see/do. I wouldn't be opposed to going back there some day.

It had to have been the most liberal Catholic church I've ever been in... Personally, I'm a fan.

These are pretty much the only sunset shots I got. I had to stop in the middle of a run to do it... So worth it.
entry.content:
Our first big trip and everything went just about as well as could be expected. We (almost) had a tropical storm (awesome), were lazy, and found a fair few neat things to see/do. I wouldn't be opposed to going back there some day.

It had to have been the most liberal Catholic church I've ever been in... Personally, I'm a fan.

These are pretty much the only sunset shots I got. I had to stop in the middle of a run to do it... So worth it.

entry.title: T Minus 14
entry.summary:
14 days left. It's hard to really believe it.

There are also two photosynths in this set. They're still a lot of fun to take, although I haven't often (ever) included them in the same post before!

Here we are at the city center, just down from the hotel. It's starting to get on in the day, sot he lights are on around the monument.

It's a bit old timey and definitely a bit funny on the colors, but it's mostly awesome from a photosynthy point of view.
entry.content:
14 days left. It's hard to really believe it.

There are also two photosynths in this set. They're still a lot of fun to take, although I haven't often (ever) included them in the same post before!

Here we are at the city center, just down from the hotel. It's starting to get on in the day, sot he lights are on around the monument.

It's a bit old timey and definitely a bit funny on the colors, but it's mostly awesome from a photosynthy point of view.

entry.title: New Year's Eve Eve
entry.summary: New Year's Eve Eve at my parent's house. Since we were heading back up for New Year's we had a few sparklers and fireworks early. 'twas a perfect opportunity to break out my DSLR for the first time in far too long.
entry.content: New Year's Eve Eve at my parent's house. Since we were heading back up for New Year's we had a few sparklers and fireworks early. 'twas a perfect opportunity to break out my DSLR for the first time in far too long.

entry.title: St. Malachy Photosynth
entry.summary: I've had this on my list of photosynths to take for quite a while now, so I figured we might as well wait after mass and take it. It's really quite a nice looking piece of architecture. Also quite different from all of the very traditional cross-shaped churches I grew up with.
entry.content: I've had this on my list of photosynths to take for quite a while now, so I figured we might as well wait after mass and take it. It's really quite a nice looking piece of architecture. Also quite different from all of the very traditional cross-shaped churches I grew up with.
